CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 7, 1946, pg. 9 reads: "Bride And Groom - Miss Emma Glass, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Early Glass, became the bride of Joseph H. Mixon Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph H. Mixon, in rites read by the Rev. H.S.Mason of St. Luke. The matron of honor was Rebecca Mixon, and best man was Northare Conley.  The nuptials were followed by a reception held at the home of the bride, after which the newlyweds left on a honeymoon trip to Philadelphia.-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Groom Joseph H. Mixon Jr. wearing dark jacket with rounded lapels and light colored pants, and bride Emma Glass Mixon, wearing gown with sweetheart neckline, small bow shaped brooch, and beaded necklace, posed in front of dark curtain in Harris Studio, another version
